title: Modify device firmware to send logs over TCP
description: Update device firmware to send log messages via TCP socket to the host machine instead of (or in addition to) serial output. Device should: 1) Connect to TCP server on host at startup, 2) Send log events over TCP when they occur, 3) Handle reconnection if connection is lost, 4) Only log meaningful events (state changes, errors), not continuous WiFi status dumps.
acceptance_criteria: Device connects to TCP server on host machine
Log events are sent over TCP in real-time
WiFi debug spam is removed or throttled
Changes tested on actual device hardware
